summary: This is an internal email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York discussing a CD titled 'Epstein Murder Evidence' that was received by mail. The sender describes the materials as appearing to be from 'a crazy person' and seeks advice on whether to produce it to the defense, while expressing an inclination not to produce it.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email discussing the handling of a CD titled 'Epstein Murder Evidence' and seeking advice on whether to produce it to the defense.

events.title: Email regarding 'Epstein Murder Evidence' CD
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney sends an email discussing a CD received by mail titled 'Epstein Murder Evidence' and seeks advice on whether to produce it to the defense.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
keyFacts: A CD titled 'Epstein Murder Evidence' was received by mail and saved on a Department of Justice server.
The Assistant United States Attorney describes the materials as appearing to be from 'a crazy person'.
The prosecutor is inclined not to produce the CD to the defense but seeks advice first.
The email indicates internal deliberation about handling potentially unsubstantiated evidence related to Epstein's death.
